abstract: The state’s attorney general said Moody’s Investors Service and Standard & Poor’s appear to be manipulating reports to help electric utilities in the state.
snippet: The state’s attorney general said Moody’s Investors Service and Standard & Poor’s appear to be manipulating reports to help electric utilities in the state.
lead_paragraph: Moody’s Investors Service and Standard & Poor’s, the big credit ratings agencies, appear to be manipulating their reports to help the largest electric utilities in Illinois charge higher prices for power, the state’s attorney general asserted in papers filed yesterday.

headline.main: Illinois Questions Ratings Agencies Gave to Utilities
headline.print_headline: Illinois Questions Ratings Agencies Gave to Utilities

abstract: the Aurora Capital Group said Wednesday that it was close to finalizing its acquisition of a software developer, Mitchell International of San Diego, for more than $500 million. It was announced last month that Hellman & Friedman of San Francisco would sell Mitchell, but no price had been disclosed. General Electric Pension Trust is a co-investor in the purchase. Mitchell’s management is also investing in the deal and will have a stake of about 15 percent.
lead_paragraph: the Aurora Capital Group said Wednesday that it was close to finalizing its acquisition of a software developer, Mitchell International of San Diego, for more than $500 million. It was announced last month that Hellman & Friedman of San Francisco would sell Mitchell, but no price had been disclosed. General Electric Pension Trust is a co-investor in the purchase. Mitchell’s management is also investing in the deal and will have a stake of about 15 percent.

headline.main: Aurora to Acquire Mitchell for $500 Million
